description: Erection of two semi-detached two storey dwellinghouses, with associated amenity space and boundary treatments - Regulation 3 (Application by London Borough of Ealing)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings:   Proposed Site Plan - A-BA2-S52-DR-0100 Rev E; Existing Site Location Plan - A_BA2-S52-DR_0001 Rev A; Existing/Proposed Street Elevation - A_BA2-S52-DR_0200 Rev C; 4B6P House Type-A Unit Plan - A_BA2-S52-DR_0300 Rev C; Proposed Unit Elevations - A_BA2-S52-DR_0310 Rev C; Arboricultural Impact Assessment 56156v5, prepared by Landscape Planning Ltd; Affordable Housing Statement; Design and Access Statement EAL-EGS_BA2_S52-RP 0001, dated September 2015, prepared by JLL; Energy and Sustainability Statement dated 22/09/2015, prepared by HTA; Planning Statement and Statement of Community Involvement (SCI), dated October 2015, prepared by JLL.    Reason:  In the interests of accuracy and proper planning. | Prior to the commencement of works (excluding demolition, site clearance and preparation works), the following detailed information shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval:  a) An intrusive contaminated land investigation and risk assessment of the site, carried out in accordance with BS1075:2011+A1:2013 and CR11 guidance, to assess the nature and extent of any contamination on the site. This assessment must be undertaken by a competent person and shall assess any contamination on the site.    b) A contamination remediation scheme to bring the relevant parts of the site to a condition suitable for the intended end use. The scope of the remediation scheme shall include details of all works to be undertaken, proposed remediation objectives and remediation criteria, a timetable of works and site management procedures.  The remediation scheme must ensure that the site will not qualify as contaminated land under Part 2A of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to the intended use of the land after remediation.  Within six-months of the completion of measures identified in the approved contamination remediation scheme, a verification report (in accordance with the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1') that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.   Reason: Further investigations of the presence of soil contamination within the application site and details of the methods for remediation are required before the commencement of building works in order to ensure that human health and the environment are protected, and to ensure the development activities do not activate or spread contamination in accordance with policies LV5.21 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), Policy 5.21 of the London Plan 2015, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG. | Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification) no development to any dwellinghouse hereby approved under Classes A-H of Part 1 and Classes A - C of Part 2 of Schedule 2 to the said Order shall be carried out or constructed without express planning permission.   Reason:  To enable the Local Planning Authority to maintain control over extensions and other alterations to dwellinghouses in the interests of the design and character of the properties, the visual amenities of the locality and amenities of occupiers of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015), policies 1.1(h) and 1.2(f) of the Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policies LV7.4, 7B and 7D of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013). | No development shall commence until tree protection measures set out within the approved Arboricultural Impact Assessment 56156v5 (20 October 2015) prepared by Landscape Planning Ltd, in accordance with BS 5837:2012 'Trees in Relation to Design, Demolition and Construction' are put in place. The tree protection measures shall be retained throughout the demolition of existing buildings and construction of the approved development, in accordance with the recommendations in BS5837 (2012).   The tree protection measures shall be retained until the development has been completed.  The areas enclosed by the tree protection measures shall not be used for any storage and the levels within these areas shall not be altered.  The trees which are proposed for removal shall be replaced in the next planting season following the completion of works on-site.   Reason: The protection of trees and other vegetation is required in accordance with policies 7.19 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2015), and interim SPG 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'.
